citations.narrative:
The facility has an ineffective pest control program that is not sufficient to control the pest population. In a shed at the
facility, with bulk food storage and an opossum enclosure, there are areas of accumulated rodent feces primarily along
the side and back walls. Several wall panels have smaller holes and a larger hole has been created on the floor along the
front wall and behind a metal bin. Pests can post a hazard to the health and wellbeing of the animals by either injuring
them, exposing them to potential diseases and illness, or contamination of the food. Correct by 18 July 2025 by
establishing and maintaining a safe and effective program for the control of insects, ectoparasites, and avian and
mammalian pests.

citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
Several bird enclosures have surfaces that are not being cleaned frequently enough. The enclosures have accumulated
amounts of excreta piled on the floor and against the wire mesh walls. Excessive excreta in primary enclosures can soil
the birds, increase disease hazards, and attract pests into the enclosure. Correct by 4 July 2025 by removing excreta and
food waste from primary enclosures and from under and around primary enclosures as often as necessary to prevent
excessive accumulation and soiling of the birds, and to reduce disease hazards, insects, pests, and odors.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
3.131(d) 
   
Sanitation. 
The facility has an ineffective pest control program that is not sufficient to control the pest population. In a shed at the 
facility, with bulk food storage and an opossum enclosure, there are areas of accumulated rodent feces primarily along 
the side and back walls. Several wall panels have smaller holes and a larger hole has been created on the floor along the 
front wall and behind a metal bin. Pests can post a hazard to the health and wellbeing of the animals by either injuring 
them, exposing them to potential diseases and illness, or contamination of the food. Correct by 18 July 2025 by 
establishing and maintaining a safe and effective program for the control of insects, ectoparasites, and avian and 
mammalian pests. 
3.158(a)(1) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
Several bird enclosures have surfaces that are not being cleaned frequently enough. The enclosures have accumulated 
amounts of excreta piled on the floor and against the wire mesh walls. Excessive excreta in primary enclosures can soil 
the birds, increase disease hazards, and attract pests into the enclosure. Correct by 4 July 2025 by removing excreta and 
food waste from primary enclosures and from under and around primary enclosures as often as necessary to prevent 
excessive accumulation and soiling of the birds, and to reduce disease hazards, insects, pests, and odors. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
 n
